issue.title: Is this repo maintained?
issue.body:
Hello @,

Looks like no updates made for long time, and I don't see comments on issues. 

I followed the installation guide and wasn't able to run the app. Do you guys are planning to keep maintain it? Other wise, that would be nice if you can add notification to website and archive the repo? 

Thanks.

issue.title: Which ruby version to be used
issue.body:
## The command which fails

```
 mvn install -P vagrant
```

## Description

The initial description states ruby version to be 2.0.0
But building vagrant it fails saying:

> xmlrpc-0.3.0 requires ruby version >= 2.3

On upgrading ruby version, I get another failure

> oneops-admin-adapter-1.0.0 requires ruby version >= 1.9.0, <= 2.1.0

This points to an impossible direction which requires: 

> ruby version >= 1.9.0, <= 2.1.0 and ruby version >= 2.3

issue.title: Build failure at Distribution
issue.body:
Cloned the repository to setup  a core build on my ubuntu 16.04 machine.
Have a couple of questions but before that, this is the order of my commands run:
1 . git clone https://github.com/oneops/oneops
2 . cd oneops
3 . mvn clean install -P vagrant -Dmaven.test.skip=true.....
After running these, the build fails at Distribution which says 
**Failed to execute goal io.takari.maven.plugins:provisio-maven-plugin:0.1.50:provision (default-provision) on project distribution: Error provisioning assembly.: The specified file /home/raghava/SourceOneOps/oneops/oneops-distribution/target/distribution-18.05.30-8-SNAPSHOT-oneops.tar.gz does not exist**

My questions:
1 . does the build still work for this repository?
3 . Is the build supported for ubuntu?
2 . why is there no distribution-18.05.30-8-SNAPSHOT-oneops.tar.gz file made in my target folder inside oneops-distribution and is there a way i can generate this explicitly?
.....................................
It will be extremely helpful if i could get any direction on how to proceed.
Thanks in advance :)

issue.title: Feedback on suspicious comments in Chef scripts
issue.body:
Greetings,

I am a security researcher, who is looking for security smells in Chef scripts.
I found instances where certain keywords such as TODO, HACK, FIXME, bug repository IDs, in comments within Chef scripts.
According to the Common Weakness Enumeration organization this is a security weakness
(CWE-546: Suspicious Comment https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/546.html).

I am trying to find out if you agree with the findings. I think it is possible to have a nuanced perspective. Any feedback is appreciated.

Source:

1. https://github.com/oneops/oneops/blob/master/oneops-admin/lib/shared/cookbooks/artifact/libraries/chef_artifact.rb

issue.title: Provide Instructions and Automation for Connecting to Azure
issue.body:
If I stand-up a OneOps instance locally and I want to create Clouds that point to Azure there are no instructions for doing this with the system as configured. I'm not sure what packs to install or even where to begin.

We need to document the process of getting your OneOps installation updated with the necessary circuit to connect to Azure. Ideally you would be able to run a script that would automate the installation of the necessary components, and this script would also be able to quickly configure some clouds to get a user started.

issue.title: Provide Instructions and Automation for Connecting OneOps to AWS
issue.body:
If I stand-up a OneOps instance locally and I want to create Clouds that point to AWS EC2, EBS, ELB, and other AWS resources there is no instructions for doing this with the system as configured.   I'm not sure what packs to install or even where to begin.

We need to document the process of getting your OneOps installation updated with the necessary circuit to connect to AWS.   Ideally you would be able to run a script that would automate the installation of the necessary components, and this script would also be able to quickly configure some clouds to get a user started.

issue.title: Provide a Default Account and Organization for a New OneOps Instance
issue.body:
We either need to build in a default account and organization or we need to provide a script that we can point a user to which will populate some of the basic account and organization objects.

Why do I think we need this?  It is about onboarding experience.  When you start using a product like OneOps, and when you are introducing a new user to something like this you want to be able to get them productive quickly. 

If we want to be consistent with something like WaRM (Nexus) then an account admin/admin123 would be what we would need here.   I also think we should just have a default organization.

issue.title: The OneOps AMI images are Outdated and Unmaintained
issue.body:
Does anyone update these with every OneOps release?   When I attempted to start using OneOps 
on AWS with these AMIs I was met with a series of misconfigurations and failures.

It isn't clear from the documentation which image to choose.  The versions display have no meaning to a new user, and there is no way for a potential user to see which of these images is most recent.  The documentation needs to be more explicit about an exact version to select.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36787/27920106-2e79f330-6239-11e7-9113-11d1403b6ce2.png)

issue.title: Major version is getting from the pack version platforms_controller.rb
issue.body: The major version is hardcoded like 1 so whatever data is replaced by 1 so it is now getting from the version.

issue.title: action order support for gslb migration
removed shared
Added support for forked fog-openstack gem on VMs - older chef/ruby.
Make change to have exec-order install custom fog-openstack
issue.body:
1.  On every exec-order run it will try to install custom fog-openstack
    along with each dependencies one at a time to avoid dependencies
    restriction.

    e.g. --ignore-dependencies

2.  Package fog-openstack-0.1.24.gem in share so it can be rsync
    to use on remote target.

issue.title: Updating exising Ruby to 2.0.0-p648.
issue.body:
This PR will prepare exec-order.rb to perform update to existing
system where we have older version of Ruby (e.g. 1.8.7).  This
will also will be compatible with upcoming Fast Image effort where
Ruby 2.0.0 is pre-installed.

This update procedure will not activate unless the cloud config
for the compute has been configured with env RUBY2_BINARY.  This
env must be a valid Ruby 2.0.0-p648 binary (pre-compiled).  This
also mean that it must be installed at the following location:
/home/oneops/ruby/ruby-2.0.0-p648.

On the first run when it is successfully acquired WRITE lock
only then Ruby update will happen.  This to ensure that we are
perform Ruby update with multiple proccesses.  Once the system
has been update exec-order.rb will be configured to use the new
Ruby.  At that point it will be just a wrapper to relaunch itself
by using newer Ruby.

Expectation on the inital run can run anywhere between 1-3 minutes
while Ruby 2.0 is being download and install.  Any subsequent runs
it will be normal.

issue.title: Ensure graphviz rpm is installed.
issue.body:
Need to install GraphViz (http://graphviz.org/) to use ruby-graphviz gem. 

For more information about Ruby-Graphviz:
* Doc : rdoc.info/projects/glejeune/Ruby-Graphviz
* Sources : github.com/glejeune/Ruby-Graphviz
* On Rubygems: rubygems.org/gems/ruby-graphviz
* NEW - Mailing List : groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/ruby-graphviz

issue.title: Refactor exec-order to install missing gems per Gemfile.
issue.body:
Refactor exec-order to install missing gems per Gemfile.
Modify create_gemfile to return output of Gemfile if no
argument is given to provide backward compatibility.

Use create_gemfile to compare system if install is needed.

Refactor gen_gemfile_and_install to check bundle install if
current bundle is up to date per Gemfile if not then update
it.

issue.title: Ensure dev-tools setup-scripts are present.
issue.body:
Ensure setup-scripts are present and patched under oneops-packer project. Also updated packer template to ensure setup-scripts are installed and available for the oneops setup. 

Please refer to archived repository that is referenced in the oneops-setup.sh script. 
https://github.com/oneops-archive/dev-tools

issue.title: Refactor exec-order to install missing gems per Gemfile.
issue.body:
Refactor exec-order to install missing gems per Gemfile.
Modify create_gemfile to return output of Gemfile if no
argument is given to provide backward compatibility.

Use create_gemfile to compare system if install is needed.

Refactor gen_gemfile_and_install to check bundle install if
current bundle is up to date per Gemfile if not then update
it.

issue.title: zt-exec library implementation
issue.body: zt-exec library has been implemented in oneops inductor.

issue.title: Long wait output issue has been fixed
issue.body: There was an issue with write method. It takes too much time while printing long output like node. A new method has been added to resolve this issue.
